fields.description:
If you add an empty repository to Fisheye (with no revisions), in {{fisheye.out}} there will be log messages every minute saying that the indexes are being updated:

{noformat}
13:07:49 INFO  - upgrading quicksearch data of repository TestRepo
13:07:49 INFO  - upgrading suffix path indexes of repository TestRepo
13:08:49 INFO  - upgrading quicksearch data of repository TestRepo
13:08:49 INFO  - upgrading suffix path indexes of repository TestRepo
13:09:50 INFO  - upgrading quicksearch data of repository TestRepo
13:09:50 INFO  - upgrading suffix path indexes of repository TestRepo
{noformat}

To reproduce:

1. Create a new empty SVN repository - {{svnadmin create TestRepo}}
2. Add the new repository to Fisheye

Notice the log messages.  These messages will stop logging once you commit something to the repository.
fields.summary: Empty Repository Causes Consistent Messages in Logs

fields.description:
Possible recurrence of issue reported as FE-2573.

Many (not all) of the UCM activities we submit to our repository are being duplicated in the Fisheye Activity screens.

Repository details from config.xml:

  <repository name="LteSource" description="LteSource (fisheye 2.3.2)" store-diff="true" enabled="true"><clearcase viewLocation="/view/ltebuild_lms_int/" indexStartDate="" viewStorageLocation="" ucm="true" integrationOnly="false" includeIntegrationActivities="true" autoCreateView="false"><vobRules><vobToProcess>vob:/vob/ltecore/src</vobToProcess></vobRules><ucmProjectRules><vobToProcess>project:LMS@/vob/ltecore/pvob</vobToProcess></ucmProjectRules></clearcase>
      <security><required-groups/></security>
</repository>

Screenshots showing duplicate commits attached.
fields.summary: Some clearcase/UCM commits are being duplicated.

fields.description:
FishEye indexes ClearCase repositories on a branch-by-branch basis. This causes problems for branchpoints. FishEye correctly detects the branchpoint, but fails to set up the link between the ancestor when that branch hasn't been processed yet and as a result it hasn't created an entry for the parent in the infdb index.

There is no way to force processing to be done in the 'correct' order, because branching is a per-file operation in ClearCase. As a result, some files may be branched branch1 > branch2, while other files are branched branch2 > branch1. The fix is to change the processing model from per-vob-per-branch to per-vob and process all events/activities sorted by date.
fields.summary: Clearcase: Branch points ancestorlinks aren't being created when the branches are processed in the wrong order

fields.description:
In base ClearCase, the grouping of checkins into a changeset is done by taking the branch and the datetime (trimmed down to the minute) of the checking. This will result in incorrect grouping when:

* a user does multiple unrelated checkins on the same branch in the same minute.
* two users do unrelated checkins on the same branch in the same minute.
fields.summary: ClearCase: checkins of different users may be grouped into the same changeset

fields.description:
Project Page: e.g. https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/project/CR-FE, for paths where if !repo.getCfg().isLoCAvailable() add "(No Line History (i:"fisheye.no.loc.available"))" to repo name.
    If possible in < 1hr, if all paths !repo.isLoCAvailable(), remove 
    * Line History Chart
    * Total lines of code
    * Net change in LoC

(i:"fisheye.no.loc.available") is a help link to fisheye.no.loc.available key
fields.summary: LoC: Fix UI for Projects Page

This is a pure guess as I have not debugged the problem at all.

From the error "reviewreportimg;jsessionid=1n4ep4ogz72zg." it looks like jessionid is appended to the wrong place in the URL.

My guess is that a WebWork tags are used incorrectly by FishEye or Crucible to generate the URL, such that jsessionid is appended in the wrong place.

There should be away to disable appending jsessionid at all in WebWork. This could be a configuration parameter or we may have to patch WebWork.

Cheers,
Anton

fields.description:
When indexing in DvcsScanner.indexUpdatedContent(), the status is set as a file is added to the list of things to process.

Rather, it should be set as the content is actually processed in HgScanner.indexContentBlock (and the corresponding git call), else if an error occurs, it looks like the process is stuck on indexing the final file in the batch.
fields.summary: HG: status while indexing content is misleading.

fields.description:
Lucene only appends to its index files, marking items as deleted.
Content indexing currently removes the indexes for non-HEAD revisions, so over time these marked for delete indexes use more and more space on disk.

Add an Admin task to optimise the indexes for space - this will have to take incrmental indexing off-line while it does this potentially expensive operation, so create some tests replicating years worth of data and check timings before implementing this.
fields.summary: Optimise space utilisation for lucene indexes

fields.description:
It appears that if you configure Fisheye to connect to SVN over SSH, once it has a successful connection it will cache those credentials until the system is restarted.

A simple test to reproduce this is:
* Add a new SVN+SSH repository, but don't specify a username or password.
* Click "Test Connection", Fisheye will give a message saying that the username or password hasn't been defined.
* Then provide a valid username and password and Test Connection again, and it should work.
* Next, REMOVE the username/password and try to test the connection and you will see that Fisheye will again say that the connection is valid.

Fisheye will then happily index the repository using the cached credentials.  However, if you look at {{config.xml}} it won't store the username or password for the connection.

Once Fisheye is restarted, the cache appears to be cleared and Fisheye will be unable to connect to the SVN repository until the user/pass is again added to the configuration.
fields.summary: SVN+SSH Credentials Cached Until Restart

fields.description:
Ina  merge commit, if a file is modified then we get a diff to parent0 which generates a LOC change. This change can be the sum of the changes we have already indexes down the parent1 branch, so the LOC count for all those commits gets duplicated in the merge.

Need to spec out a way of dealing with this, review that and then fix.
fields.summary: HG: Line Count totals broken for merge commits.

fields.description:
* One solution — create internal labels for anonymous branches - make unscheduled
* May be subject to how we implement higher UX features whether this is a problem or we want to display per-head LoC for a branch.
fields.summary: HG: Anonymous branch forks screw up LoC

fields.description:
Committer Page: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/committer/FE-hg/adam%20ahmed%20%3Caahmed%40atlassian.com%3E
    if !repo.isLoCAvailable()
    * replace Line History chart with "Line History Unavailable (i:"fisheye.no.loc.available")"
    * Remove "Files Changed" and "Change in Loc"

(i:"fisheye.no.loc.available") is a help link to fisheye.no.loc.available key
fields.summary: LoC: Fix UI for Repository Committer Page

fields.description:
In UCM ClearCase a stream can be rebased to a different foundation baseline. While FishEye does index activities merged into a stream by a 'deliver' operation, it does not index 'rebase' activities. 

What needs to be done:
* Index the foundation baseline
* Detect 'rebase' activities and (re-)index the contributing activities
fields.summary: ClearCase UCM: Rebases are not handled

fields.description: Labels are indexed only when a file revision is indexed. Labels that are applied to file revisions that has already been indexed by FishEye won't show up at all.
fields.summary: ClearCase: FE doesn't pick up labels after the revisions have been indexed initially

fields.description:
hgconvert and hgsubversion produce repos that hg does not when used natively, with file revs included in the changeset when they were just merged.

Document this more and come up with some way to work more optimally for ex-svn repos.
fields.summary: HG: Fix slurping issues for hgconvert/hgsubversion

fields.description: When switching to the Charts page, the charts will be showing data for the selected branch, but if any of the chart filters/controls are used, a form submit is made and the existing "br" or "tag" parameter is lost.
fields.summary: Reports Tab/Charts doesn't preserve  branch filter

fields.description:
Users/People page: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/users
    Have hover and "*" for "LoC" column, with explanation: Lines of Code does not contain data from Mercurial and Git repositories or repositories with "Stored Diffs" turned off (i:"fisheye.no.loc.available")"

(i:"fisheye.no.loc.available") is a help link to fisheye.no.loc.available key
fields.summary: LoC: Fix UI for People (Users) Page

fields.description:

For reference, you are able to configure the *Updater* for Git repositories.

fields.description:
When a branch is merged in git you end up with revisions chronologically interleaved on a branch --- diff to previous uses the previous revision in time where is should use the parent revision.

[CRC-1695|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-1695]
fields.summary: Diff to previous doesn't choose the right parent in git

fields.description:
From the FishEye "browse" view, in the "Constraints" box, the "Branch" dropdown doesn't work.  I have attached an example of one of our Perforce branch specifications in case it is useful.  I thought it might be the slashes in the branch name, but I tried a branch with only letters and it still failed.

Selecting any branch other than "(any)" or "head" will report the following error:

The requested resource cannot be found. 
Referer: http://devnet/crucible/browse/~br=head/BarTender/work 
no such repository - 

You are running release CR1.6.2 FE1.6.2 (build-333 2008-10-21), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
fields.summary: Perforce branch specification doesn't work

fields.description:
There are 3 different standards for newline characters. The these are:
* Line Feed ({{\n}}) - which is the standard for unix-like systems
* Carrier Return followed by a Line Feed {{\r\n}} - which is the standard for windows systems
* Carrier Return {{\r}} - which is the standard for Mac OS 9 and earlier (which is not supported for mercurial, git or fe/cru)

{{BufferedReader}} counts {{\n}}, {{\r}} and {{\r\n}} all as newline characters. GIT and Mercurial treat only {{\n}} and {{\r\n}} as newlines. Any output from GIT or Mercurial which we parse should use the GIT and mercurial standard, not the JDK implementation. Otherwise we can potentially cause errors within indexing

An example of a repository with such problem is here:
http://bitbucket.org/despiegk/pylabs-core

executing:
{code}
hg --config extensions.felog=/path/to/hgfelog.py --config ui.verbose=false felog 4fd1d042ab2b155c8aee58bc3ed919fb4c7928cd -p -m
{code}

Ideally, mercurial should fix its binary file detection. We can potentially provide a fix within the {{hgfelog.py}} mercurial extension and do detection via file extensions. Another option is to modify the implementation of {{BufferedReader.readLine()}} via a subclass or by using {{BufferedReader.read}} instead.
fields.summary: The way Fisheye handles newlines when parsing command line outputs is completely wrong

fields.description: After removing files from a Clearcase view via "rmname" (not "rmelem") the files no longer display in the view but are still visible, and are not marked as deleted, in Fisheye, even after a full reindex.
fields.summary: Using "rmname" to remove items from ClearCase - Fisheye does not mark items as deleted

fields.description: The changes to LoC due to CRUC-3811 have broken some of the tests (toString changes).
fields.summary: LoC Tests broken

fields.description:
When altering the *Polling Interval* for a ClearCase repository, it appears that Fisheye will ask to reindex the repository after the change is made.  See the attached screenshot.

For our other SCMs (Subversion for example), changing the Polling Interval only requires a *restart* of the repository, and not a reindex.
fields.summary: Changing Poller Interval on ClearCase Repository prompts for reindex

fields.description: At the moment, the algorithm picks the sub-branch with activity in the most recent day that has the greatest LoC - this is not necessarily the latest commit ("tip") in that branch.
fields.summary: When calculating total LoC should pick "tip" sub-branch

fields.description: Review coverage checks the path and throws an exception if it's invalid. Code Metrics probably should too.
fields.summary: Code Metrics: Should check validity of Path as review coverage does

fields.description:
1. Add a ClearCase repository.
2. Once the repository is added, select * Include Integration Activities* and Save.
3. View the repository settings again and notice that the setting isn't persisted.

As a temporary workaround you can shut down Fisheye and set {{includeIntegrationActivities="true"}} in the {{config.xml}} file.  Please be sure to make a backup of {{config.xml}}.
fields.summary: "Include Integration Activities" select box doesn't persist setting in admin console
QuickSearch does not search diffs on Clearcase repositories

fields.description:
It is not yet defined what this should calculate, as 1 week ago, there may be several different values for the LoC based on the extant anonymous branches at that point. 

Options:
# Remove this value (replace with "-") on the Changelog, User, Committer, Project pages.
# Calculate all the potential values and pick one of them based on (insert rationale)
# As previous, but calculate via the commit graph which are ancestors of the chosen total LoC point and then pick one as previous

fields.description:
Projects depend on the Crucible permission schemes to control access to the projects. 

If you remove Crucible (e.g. after evaluation) you can no longer edit permission schemes via the UI.
fields.summary: Can't edit project permissions in FE only mode.

fields.summary: Recent visited tabs spins forever when REST end points are disabled

fields.description:
the NPE is coming from passing a null revision into infdb


conor: DvcsCache.getLongHash can certainly return null
MichaelH: yep, and it looks like we don't have any null checks in the CommonRevInfoDAO.getRevId methods
conor: should probably be in both places. It seems to be to do with hash expansion
conor: maybe not - blame must reference a hash which we don't have in the index?
MichaelH: That's likely, but should only happen if there are exclude rules in place?

- there are no excludes

may be related to http://img.skitch.com/20101108-fqa38j4k9hj9dm4mjjx3niqwfa.jpg

fields.description:
When branches are selected to be excluded from scanning, but the list of branches to include is left empty, nothing is indexed at all.

The correct behaviour is to include all branches except the branches that have been excluded.
fields.summary: ClearCase: nothing is indexed when branch excludes is non-empty and branch includes is empty

fields.description:
Currently, the branch selector will only show the top 50 branches, ordered alphabetically.

This is confusing users, since there is no indication that:
* the list is truncated
* they can set any of the missing branches by typing in the text area at the top.


At the very least, we need to:
* indicate the dropdown contains truncated results
* mention the other branches are available when typing.

Ideally, this widget would not be a dropdown. It would simply be a type ahead. That way, there could be less confusion.

14 Jan 2013: There is a temp server set up for DoT - http://172.22.3.56:6060/foo/browse/sanity1. Contact [~lzheng] if there is any problem of the server.
fields.summary: Improve UX of Branch Selector

fields.description:
A {{config.xml}} with a blank proxy port configuration, such as:
{noformat}
<http bind=":8060" proxy-port=""/>
{noformat}
will fail to startup the application with the exception:
{noformat}
2011-05-01 17:26:54,598 INFO [main ] fisheye.app RootConfig-load - loading config from file: /usr/local/fisheye/FISHEYE_INST/config.xml
2011-05-01 17:26:55,718 ERROR [main ] fisheye.app RootConfig-load - Errors parsing /usr/local/fisheye/FISHEYE_INST/config.xml:
2011-05-01 17:26:55,719 ERROR [main ] fisheye.app RootConfig-logXmlErrors - at line 159: Invalid decimal value: expected at least one digit
2011-05-01 17:26:55,721 INFO [main ] fisheye.app Run-mainImpl - CE
com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException: Error parsing config file (see logs): /usr/local/fisheye/FISHEYE_INST/config.xml
at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.RootConfig.load(RootConfig.java:183)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.mainImpl(Run.java:102)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.main(Run.java:69)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.mainImpl(FishEyeCtl.java:113)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:41)
{noformat}

Additionally, it seems like there is no way to remove the proxy port configuration via the UI, once it has been set. All attempts to remove the port number and saving it will fail with the following exception in the logs:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
     at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:222)
     at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.admin.util.SSLUtils.isCorrectKeystorePassword(SSLUtils.java:33)
     at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.admin.actions.EditServerSettingsAction.isCorrectKeystorePassword(EditServerSettingsAction.java:312)
     at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
     at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
     at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{noformat}
There are no on-screen errors reported and the original value is still retained in the proxy port field after deleting and saving.

*Workaround:*
Edit the above configuration in {{config.xml}} as follows:
{noformat}
<http bind=":8060"/>
{noformat}
and restart Fisheye.
fields.summary: Having a blank proxy port tag in config.xml prevents Fisheye from starting up

fields.description:
Due to their distributed nature, the commit date of a changeset is not a reliable starting point for searching for revisions for watch notifications. If person A commits today and pushes today, the last sent changeset will be marked as today. If person B commits yesterday and pushes tomorrow, the commit date will be marked as yesterday so no notification will be sent when it is eventually pushed to the server.

Using an event based system, or using the incremental internal id of the changeset are 2 possible solutions
fields.summary: Watch Notification Emails are not sent correctly for Mercurial and Git repositories

fields.description:
{quote}
1. The Crucible documentation hardly speaks of Fisheye, but does cover things like repository creation. The Crucible documentation should not discuss these topics at all. People (like me) may believe that they are in fact reading complete documentation. Instead, the Crucible documentation should either be folded into the Fisheye documentation, or the Crucible documentation chapters on any Fisheye-related functionality should just defer to the Fisheye documentation. There shouldn't be any deep linking into the Fisheye documentation. It should simply say "Please consult the Fisheye documentation." Otherwise it's very likely that they'll miss extremely important points.

2. The Fisheye user interface for adding/changing a repository needs a very large warning around the symbolic name setup, stating clearly that Fisheye will likely NOT function they're not set incorrectly. The warning should always be visible whenever the repository configuration page is displayed. The warning should link to an Atlassian document describing the issue in detail (one does not exist). The warning should mention that puppies will be eaten if they don't read the document. The document should start by saying that if the symbolic name setup isn't perfect, indexing will take days or weeks and that the index will be 10+ times the size of the repository.

3. The aforementioned new document should be linked to from the top of every Subversion-related page in the Fisheye documentation, in bold with a red background. This includes the "branches and tags" pages. Since there's no Subversion-related pages left in the Crucible documentation that doesn't need to be changed.

4. The aforementioned new document should, especially, be linked from the pages that describe indexing and indexing speed. There are specific FAQs on that area and while they do mention the repository layout, the language is neither strong enough nor clear enough.

5. All documentation that discusses symbolic name setup should not use phrases like "where you store your branches" and "where you store your tags." We store our branches in /branches/ of course. A few levels down, unfortunately.
{quote}
fields.summary: Improvements to FishEye Subversion Indexing and Layout Documentation

fields.description:

Affected versions are FishEye/Crucible 2.2.8 to 2.5.2 inclusive.

* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml

This issue is reported in our security advisory on these pages:

fields.description:
After checking with Tim and Brendan, the hint for "commit messages" should be changed from 'comment' to 'commit'.

All the other hints match the labels assigned to the serach type:
* File and directories -> hint is "file"
* Diffs -> hint is "diff"
* Content -> hint is "content"
* Committers -> hint is "committer"

Except for the one to change:
* Commits -> current hint is _"comment"_ (will be "commit")

Reference: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Searching+the+Repository#SearchingtheRepository-QuickSearch]
fields.summary: Search hint: change hint for commit messages to 'commit' instead of 'comment'

fields.description:
If a search hint is specified, like {{content: abc}}, the search page will automatically select the 'Content' search type.

However, when the user clicks on a different type (ex: file paths), the page stays on the type specified by the hint. This effectively blocks the user from seeing the results from any other types.
fields.summary: Search hint: when a hint is specified, clicking on a different search type does not do anything

fields.description:
FishEye's internals have a timestamp of when its indexes were last indexed and a timestamp of the last time it checked for watches. We would search the internals based on these values which is wrong. Instead the date of the last sent changeset should be used as a starting point and search until the last indexed time.

This will only fix centralised version control systems and won't fix Git and Mercurial as someone can have changes committed in the past but not pushed to the repository which is being indexed. The way we handle watches needs to be revisited to handle this case
fields.summary: FishEye watch notifications can potentially not send changesets due to long running incremental slurps

fields.description: I can connect to the database but I can't save the configuration in the Admin console for the new Oracle database connection.  It says "The database is insensitive. Crucible requires that the database use a case sensitive collation."  We can not change the database collation and I cannot seem to get FishEye to accept my input from the command-line based off this link: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Migrating+to+Oracle#MigratingtoOracle-Fromthecommandline
fields.summary: Crucible needs a case sensitive collation

fields.description:
During an upgrade process, there's no way of migrating a specific number of repositories, i.e., not migrating all of them. The whole instance needs to be migrated.

It would be great if this could be done, because it would avoid wasting time re-indexing unwanted repositories during an upgrade.

But what would happen to the Crucible reviews associated with those "deleted" repositories? I believe they would need to be excluded from the migration as well.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Kind regards,
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Allow to migrating a specific number of repositories from one FishEye and Crucible instance to another

fields.description:
Every time a user navigates through the source tree in a FishEye repository and selects a file, IE tries to request some Fancybox jQuery plugin images that are requested with an invalid URL, that is because DXImageTransform.Microsoft.AlphaImageLoader doesn't respect CSS relative paths, so the images that are loaded by 'fisheye/src/content/static/2static/style/jquery/plugin/fancybox-overrides.css' return a HTTP 404 error.

In the case of AtlasEye this requests represent around 136Kb of uncompressed error page data that is sent back to the user browser, on *EVERY* request, as 404's are not cached by the browser, this adds up to a really sluggish user experience as IE waits all images to be loaded before handing back the control to the user.
fields.summary: When navigating through the source tree on IE some jQuery Fancybox plugin requests get a HTTP 404 error response

fields.description: on the dashboard, there is no way to know where a changeset was made to
fields.summary: add repository name back to activity items

fields.description: SVN Properties such as {{svn:ignore}} are not being shown on the changeset level.
fields.summary: SVN properties are not being indexed

fields.description:
currently we "require" that any database configured be using UTF-8.

however:
1. you can do a backup / restore to a non-UTF-8 db
2. you can manually edit the config.xml and fecru will start up (just with warnings)
3. if you are only using fisheye, this isnt really an issue and shouldnt affect you.

we should make it clear that the database is not UTF-8 when setting it up in the UI, but we should still allow the user to save the settings.
fields.summary: you should be able to set up a non-utf8 db via the ui

fields.description:
Bad code in sbs-diff.js is causing a js error.  Other code, prevented from running by the error, is setting the hash to "#undefined"

This JIRA is for fixing both.
fields.summary: Diff View - deeplink to a line using an 'l' hash (e.g., #l98) causes js error

fields.description:
Mercurial reports deleted files in the 'files' attribute of a Commit every time the "deletion" is merged (even merges on the same branch).

Thus, FishEye ends up reporting a deleted FileRevision of a file for every time it is merged. We should ignore all deletions that are the result of merges and mark them as merged in deletions instead.
fields.summary: HG: Deleted file gets multiple FileRevs for every time it is merged

fields.description:
we have code that goes:

if (!isPasswordCorrect()) {
    throw new IOException("password was incorrect")
}

but isPasswordCorrect can return false for more reasons than that. it logs the specific reason to debug level.

instead, it should throw the specific exception itself so that the user can see exactly whats going wrong. this sort of error should never be logged to debug.

the method is SSLUtils.isCorrectKeystorePassword

it is called in two places. from the WebServer and from EditServerSettingsAction - used for validation. The validation xml has the same problem. it has a "incorrect password" message regardless of why it returned false.
fields.summary: incorrect error message when SSL keystore password checking fails
Search fails when path levels are provided

fields.description:
It'd be great to provide some more clarity around author vs. creator in Crucible.  Consider the following scenario with a fresh Crucible instance:

# Person A creates a new review and add's Person B as a moderator.
# Person A leaves the company, and the moderator selects Person C as the new author of the review.
# Person C is the new author, however they can't Edit Details or Send To Moderator because they are not the creator.

This can be confusing, considering there's no other way to allow the new Author to "own" the review without editing the permission scheme for the project.

It'd be nice to see this improved a bit, by either:
* Making this clearer in our documentation.
* Providing a message to the user when the author changes that the creator does not change, and therefore by default they cannot do what a creator would do.
* Allow a way for users to change the Creator of a given review.
fields.summary: Better Experience for Changing Authors

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a Linker under Repository Settings -> Default.
2. Go to a specific repositories configuration.
3. Click on the Allow tab.
4. You'll notice the message "There are default include/exclude entries defined for all repositories", even though one isn't defined.
fields.summary: Setting Default Linker Creates "default include/exclude entries" Warning

fields.description:
if you explicitly include a subdirectory of a component, but not its root directory, it wont be indexed.

this is because we use the root dir to check if we should index it. we should also check if there are any sub dirs included.
fields.summary: clearcase ucm: we only index content roots if the root dir is included in the config. we should also index it if there is a sub directory

fields.description:
at the moment we just use utf-8

its complicated to handle commit encoding correctly, because it can change in every commit, but we could at least use a global setting - if its wrong for 1 commit, its wrong, and just defaults it to utf-8.

im not sure how this affects content encoding.
fields.summary: fisheye doesnt use encoding according to git global i18n.commitencoding
fisheye should support administrator customisable key words and patterns in the indexer and in EyeQL

fields.description:
when calling lshistory on the components in a branch, at the moment we use the "oldest of the latest times from each component" as the next index date. this was so that we could make sure that we didnt lose any data. 

we can do better than this - we should use "latest time across components" and subtract the processing time. it will still potentially be getting a little bit too much data, but it will be much less than currently.
fields.summary: clearcase ucm: we arent storing the latest possible activity time, so its possible to get a lot of unnecessary data

fields.description:
This affects what diffRevision you get, especially during merges across branches. Also, when a fast-forward merge happens to a branch (with changes on the other branch) and there are earlier changes on the target branch in another anonymous branch, we incorrectly use the other commit as the predecessor, even though it is not in the ancestry graph - very confusing diffs appear in the ChangeSet page.

Title was: hg - Missing merge?  Commit on branch has been merged to default, but changeset diff is against last changeset committed onto default directly.

The [changeset page|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE-hg/?cs=8b5a9d5de2809af96525544f1a7c31ef22942cea] is showing a diff from the last change on default, but a change on a branch was merged onto default between them.  So the real diff should be against a merge commit.  Here's the [file history|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE-hg/src/content/WEB-INF/jsp/crucible/create/edit_details.jsp?focusedRev=8b5a9d5de2809af96525544f1a7c31ef22942cea&fromRev=3c4d45818a87dd46f065c9d6e8bcdd7c9c34f851&toRev=8b5a9d5de2809af96525544f1a7c31ef22942cea#r8b5a9d5de2809af96525544f1a7c31ef22942cea] and offending [diff|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE-hg/src/content/WEB-INF/jsp/crucible/create/edit_details.jsp?r1=3c4d45818a87dd46f065c9d6e8bcdd7c9c34f851&r2=8b5a9d5de2809af96525544f1a7c31ef22942cea]
fields.summary: GIT/HG: predecessor detection (default diff) doesn't use ancestry of file when it should

fields.description:
weve changed branch indexing to get all activity (not just on the branch), so the "latest index time" should be the latest of all of the activity retrieved. 

currently its using the latest of the branch, which means for old branches, it has to re-retrieve a lot of data that it doesnt need
fields.summary: clearcase base: use the latest repository activity when indexing branches

fields.description:
For more information see [this blog post|https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1886459663].

When using Crucible services in a separate thread from the request thread, a new Hibernate session will be opened.  When the thread finishes, the Session will be left hanging around indefinitely since it cannot be cleaned up by the request thread.

Confluence and Bamboo deal with this by having the {{TransactionTemplate}} close threads that were opened for the transaction.  The FeCru implementation should do the same to ensure there aren't resource leaks.
fields.summary: FeCru TransactionTemplate implementation should close the Hibernate Session opened during the transaction
Support Firefox 4
Respect Git's global i18n.commitencoding setting

fields.description:
When running an initial index of a huge repository this may take a long time.
Currently there is a banner like

bq. The repository 'xyz' is being scanned, information from the repository may not be up to date

It would be nice if there were more information about the progress.
I understand that it may not be possible to calculate an estimated-time-left value, but some information like "x components left." or "y more files to be diffed" would be appreciable.
fields.summary: Progressbar for Initial Index

fields.description:
FECRU always use a Remember Me cookie even though it is not an UI option.

Please, make sure that this info in documented.

Also, this is why the logout has an extra step, offering the "Logout Completely" option. This would remove the Remember Me cookie.
fields.summary: Ensure that the FE Docs say thet Remeber Me cookie is always being used

fields.description:
Users intuitively want to search for text on the page when viewing a source file in FishEye.

Currently, it gets loaded progressively, only as you scroll down the page.
This is done for browser performance reasons. I think we need to revisit why this was done, and see if we can make the UX of the browse-source page better.

Could we:
* load the page in the background - up to a certain threshold of 5k lines maybe
* bump the page buffer size
* provide some other search field on that page that searches for text in the source file
fields.summary: Increase the amount of file that gets loaded on the browse source page

fields.description:

Would be good to have Groups watching repositories. It would allow Admins to pre-set what a user needs to watch
fields.summary: Allow Admin to set a group as watching a repository
Display Issues with Internet Explorer 9

fields.description:
When you edit a repository configuration in the FishEye administration section, a prompt comes up notifying you that the repository needs to be restarted. When you then click 'perform', the repository is actually re-indexed!

The workaround is to choose 'ignore' and restart the repository manually.
fields.summary: ClearCase: Editing a repository config in the admin prompts for a restart of the repository, but triggers a re-index

fields.description: When you edit a UCM ClearCase repository configuration in FishEye that has a project inclusion rule specified, the resulting config.xml is stored without an (empty) vobExclusion element. This is required according to the config.xsd and as a result FishEye fails to startup the next time the server is (re-)started.
fields.summary: UCM ClearCase: specifying a project inclusion rule and then saving the repository results in an invalid config.xml

fields.description:
Due to http://mercurial.selenic.com/bts/issue2699, we can look for a manifest entry of a file that is not in the manifest of where the filectx was created.

The fix is to check for this and avoid that lookup - fixed for the .hgsubstate bug, but could come up in other cases.

{quote}Repository index failed due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: abort: .hgsubstate@cb95ab638b7c: not found in manifest! com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsProcessException: Error while communicating with VCS: abort: .hgsubstate@cb95ab638b7c: not found in manifest! com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: While executing: "hg --config extensions.felog=/opt/j2ee/containers/crucible/builds/fecru-2.6.0-M1-20110301-1721/python/hg/hgfelog/hgfelog.py --config ui.verbose=false felog 51e8e7f3c710eca0df68059ec2bac3520930c65e -p -m " com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 255
{quote}
fields.summary: HG indexing fails with "not found in manifest!" error
